Frequently Askes Questions

Welcome to the help of CCI:U. We are listing the most frequently asked questions. To send a detailed feedback, please see contact.

  • How to connect to my instances via SSH (and using PuTTY)?
  • How to use Hadoop?

Help: Using SSH

This is the key to connect and send commands to your instances. Please follow the following instructions. :)

For command-line envrionments (like Linux, Cygwin, etc.)

  1. Click [Get Private Key] button in the team console and save it as a file like my-cciu.key.
  2. Run the following command: 
    $ ssh -i my-cciu.key root@<Public DNS of a instance>
  3. Now you will see the root prompt on your instance.

For PuTTY

PuTTY does not accept the private key as in the format we provide. You can convert it to PuTTY's private key format with the following instructions.

  1. Save the private key like above.
  2. Open PuTTYgen (PuTTY Key Generator) application.
  3. Click [Load] button and choose the saved key.
    (Set the file format combobox to 'All Files (*.*)'.)
    You will see a message saying “Successfully imported foreign key (OpenSSH SSH-2 private key).”.
  4. In the File menu, click [Save private key].
    You may be alerted by a passphrase warning, but unless you want to type a password whenever you connect to instances, just press [Yes] to ignore it.
    Here, you can save the private key as a converted ppk file.
  5. Close PuTTYgen and run Pageant.
  6. Click [Add Key] from the tray menu of Pageant and select the ppk file saved above.
  7. Don't terminate Pageant. Now run PuTTY and connect to your instances via the Public DNS addresses. You'll not need any log-in process. :)

Help: Using Hadoop

If your team instances are deployed as a Hadoop cluster, you can use a fully initialized Hadoop environment.

Viewing the job tracker

You can view the job tracker provided by Hadoop with the following methods:

  • Click [View Job Tracker] button at the team console page.
  • Connect to your master node directly with address like http://<MasterIP>:<DefaultTrackerPort>.

You have to allocate a public IP to the master node first.

Once your team instances are initialized as a Hadoop cluster, dynamic addition of new instances without destroying existing ones is impossible due to technical reasons. Before requesting more instances to your team cluster, be sure that your important data and programs are backuped.
